meanings.sent1: Her tweedier jacket kept her warm on the chilly day.
meanings.sent2: The tweedier pattern on the skirt gave it a traditional look.
meanings.sent3: He felt like a walking tweedier fashion show in his outfit.
meanings.sent4: The room had a tweedier atmosphere with its earthy tones and textures.
meanings.sent5: The tweedier design of the chair reminded her of her grandfather's study.

meanings.definition: More old-fashioned or conservative in style.
meanings.sent1: The tweedier hat made him look like he stepped out of a different era.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the tweedier dresses with their classic cuts.
meanings.sent3: The tweedier decor in the room made it feel like a vintage movie set.
meanings.sent4: His tweedier taste in music included a lot of jazz and swing.
meanings.sent5: The tweedier approach to the project was met with mixed reactions from the team.
